subject: AI & Agents
title: World Models: Simulating Reality
description: A quick win: understand World Models: Simulating Reality.

hook.text: An AI that doesn't just describe the world but builds an internal model of how it works.

buildup.text: World models learn physics, causality, and dynamics by observing how environments change over time.

discovery.text: They can predict what happens next â€” a ball rolling off a table will fall, a door pushed will swing.

twist.text: Current world models are brittle. They fail on scenarios slightly outside their training distribution.

climax.text: Robust world models could be the missing piece for general-purpose robotics and autonomous vehicles.

punchline.text: First, model the world. Then, act intelligently within it.

quiz.question: What do world models attempt to learn?
options: Physics, causality, and how environments change over time
